a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Twentieth century of deaths, United States, 1900 to 1998
Total annual deaths in the United States, broken down by broad category of causes. Non-communicable
diseases (NCDs) includes cardiovascular diseases (heart diseases and strokes), cancers, respiratory
disease and diabetes. Accidents includes road accidents, falls, fires, drowning, accidential poisonings.
The remaining category includes communicable, infectious, neonatal and other non-NCD health
Data source: Centre for Diseases Control (CDC)
